paragraphs.text: Philip Dray is an American writer and historian, known for his comprehensive analyses of American scientific, racial, and labor history.

paragraphs.title: Awards
paragraphs.text: Dray's work At the Hands of Persons Unknown: The Lynching of Black America won the Robert F. Kennedy Book Award.[1] He was a finalist in 2003 for a Pulitzer Prize in history.[2]
